roomTip: Best pic of hotels in Weligama.
text: Our stay was fantastic. There was a lovely view of the ocean from our room and the amenities were very clean. The pool was amazing and the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. We needed gluten free food and the chefs were very happy to make us gluten free pizza and pasta as well as a variety of other foods including pancakes for breakfast. The only suggestion we have would be to have more encouragement from the staff to do scheduled activities. One idea would be to use the lawn more for scheduled kids club activities as many kids prefer to be surrounded by kids their age in an environment suited for everyone. Also, for the kids disco it should be out on the lawn with some disco lights and speakers rather than in the small room so more children get involved. Overall we had an amazing stay and we will recommend.
title: Lovely Experience

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
Great location right on the beach overlooking the Indian Ocean.
We had a room on the 6th floor overlooking the Indian Ocean and each evening watched some amazing sunsets.
The room is the standard Marriott rooms and had everything you would normally have. Rooms were clean and tidy. 
We had breakfast included in the price with an extensive choice. If you can’t find something to eat at breakfast you are very hard to please.
We had dinner at the same restaurant in the evening and chose the Al la carte menu. Great choice and due to us needing Gluten free the chefs were only too please to help. 
Our last evening the restaurant team went that extra mile.  The lady who greeted us on our last evening decorated the table which was a lovely thought A big shout out must go to Pradeep who did exceptionally well as we were his first customers to serve us! 
Overall,  would recommend this hotel and would stay again.
title: Would stay again!

roomTip: Off season is good as well
text:
I booked for 3 nights for the end of my trip in Sri Lanka, and it was the best decision ever!! 
Overall, I traveled for 2 weeks in Arugam Bay, Ella, and finally Weligama, and it was the best hotel I have stayed in by far!
I had the best time staying there. The staff was incredibly nice and welcoming. They've helped me in everything I needed and always with a smile.
Breakfast was amazing and with a lot of variety, including local Srilankan food. The room was tidy, clean, and beautiful with an amazing sea view. 
They had a spa, yoga classes, cocktail making class, pool, bar, kids' playroom, a few lounges, sauna, surfing schools, and many more facilities.
Loved it! It's worth every penny!
title: Amazing experience !

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
From the first second arriving at this property we were treated like a number and not like a customer.

When we arrived in a private car, we were met by security at the curbside. In a commanding tone, we were told to send all our luggage through the screening like at the airport. After security, we were met by a lady. Unfortunately, the tone did not change even though it was now a hotel employee. She bossed us around: we should go here, it's full, go over there, do this, do that. No warm welcome, nothing at all. No smiles and far from a warm welcome.
At reception we were greeted in a fake American buddy manner, as if we had known each other for decades. So artificial, so wrong.
The first ray of hope came after check-in when a guest relations lady accompanied us to our room.
Here, too, everything was prepared but there was absolutely no love, no passion for detail and the Marriott standards were not adhered to.
OK, maybe it's our fault, we thought, and went to the pool for a cool off and a drink.

There were 4 employees at the pool bar, 3 of them wearing sunglasses and 4 playing on their cell phones.
As a customer, you have to make yourself known if you want something.
The tables by the loungers at the pool are almost all broken. Lounger cushions are only available if you ask for them and the parasols are just lying around. A poor reflection of a Marriott hotel.

Yes, the employees may be polite but they are miles and miles away from professional customer service and hospitality.

We felt unwelcome from the first second as well as treated like a number and not like a paying customer.

This was not a place we wanted to stay for 6 days to spend our vacation. We paid for one night and then left straight after 2.5 hours.
Absolutely no one was interested.

We personally cannot recommend this hotel at all.
title: You are treated as a number and not as a customer!

text:
We stayed at the Marriott for a three day long weekend.  The hotel does need a little bit of refurbishment. There were little lapses in attention to detail with regards to check in and room preparation ( we had booked a triple room but it had been prepared for only two guests), however all in all the holiday was relaxing and interactions with staff were pleasant and cordial.

The room had an excellent ocean view and was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent and had a very good variety of Asian. Indian, Sri Lankan and western dishes.  Probably the tastiest I've had in terms of hotel buffets which are usually relatively bland in taste. 

The highlight of the trip for me, personally was the usage of the gym, the yoga and meditation sessions conducted by Chaman. The sessions were conducted in a beach side hut with a lovely incoming breeze. Chaman conducted a very zen session which left me and my friend relaxed, rejuvenating and in a positive frame of mind. 

I will certainly return to the Marriott at least to experience Chaman's  yoga and meditation programmes.
title: Lovely Getaway

roomTip: Select a upper floors to get incredible view.
text:
We selected Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa as our south coast destination for surfing.
We had a smooth check-in with a warm welcome.
We have two rooms on the 9th floor with a magnificent Weligama bay view.
During our two-day stay, we were relaxed and enjoyed the sea view.
When it comes to the room's interior, the interior design is elegant,  bathroom is spotless and accessible. Also, the bedding arrangement was neat. It has all the amenities, that we were looking for in a 5-star hotel.

Above all, the staff showed attentiveness and politeness in their service, which exceeded our expectations.
Our teenage kids enjoy the surfing facility at the Weligama Bay beach. We came across a well-experienced and fantastic trainer who helped them learn the basics of surfing and within two days, they managed to surf with less help.
In any hotel, the main thing always looking for is food. We had a fantastic culinary experience with their dinner and breakfast buffet. It had a good spread from Asian to European selections. We had a high tea experience one afternoon and it was incredible.

 This hotel will be our definite choice for our next surfing vacation. Even though we visited Weligama in the off-season, our kids could experience the best waves. I would recommend visiting from December to May, as it's the best time to catch some waves.
title: Great place to have a surfing experience in Sri Lanka

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
**Avoid if You’re a Strict Vegetarian**

I am currently staying at the Weligama Bay Marriott, and unfortunately, my experience has been quite disappointing, particularly as a vegetarian. The selection of vegetarian dishes is extremely limited, and more troubling, vegetarian and non-vegetarian items are placed together, with many guests using the same utensils for both. This raises serious concerns about cross-contamination, especially for those with strict dietary preferences. Additionally, there were no vegetarian dessert options, which was quite surprising for a hotel of this standard.

The pasta was mediocre, and overall, the hospitality has been lacking. Despite raising my concerns multiple times, the staff has been slow to respond, if at all. While the location is undeniably beautiful, the service does not match the 5-star standard the hotel claims—it feels more like a 3-star experience.

Although the shift manager did send some desserts and assured me I could place custom orders, the issues persisted. When I requested an avocado toast at breakfast, I was told avocados were unavailable, which was surprising given that Sri Lanka is a significant avocado exporter. Later, when I inquired about a risotto for dinner, I was informed it would incur an additional charge. While I am happy to pay for special requests, I am already on a half-board plan with dinner prepaid, making the extra charge unnecessary and frustrating.

In conclusion, if you are a strict vegetarian or have specific dietary requirements, I would strongly recommend seeking alternative accommodations. While the location is beautiful, the dining experience and overall service standards leave much to be desired.
title: “Avoid if you are strict vegetarian and looking for a 5 star experience “

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
The Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa in Sri Lanka consistently receives excellent reviews for its luxurious amenities and prime beachfront location. Guests rave about the exceptional service, modern rooms with stunning ocean views, and the wide variety of food options at breakfast. Many highlight the direct access to the beach and excellent surf conditions, perfect for beginners. The hotel’s pool, spa, and fitness facilities are also highly praised, making it ideal for both relaxation and wellness activities.

However, some guests have noted that food and beverages can be on the pricier side compared to other local options, as expected from a five-star resort. The loungers around the pool can also fill up quickly during peak hours. Despite these minor issues, visitors often leave with a sense of fulfillment, particularly enjoying the serene environment and impeccable hospitality.

.
title: Great place to visit with family

text:
I didn't like staying here and don't understand the great reviews. The hotel is very old and in need of an update. The rooms are a nice size but everything is old and rusty, our toilet seat broken and the room generally just felt old and very dated.  
It has the feel of a hotel that has not been updated for 20 years. 
The pool area again feels very old with fake decking around the pool. 

I wish I had stayed at one of the boutique hotels instead. This is very basic accommodation suitable for people with kids
title: In need of major renovation to modernise and make nice again

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
roomTip: The pool was super crowded during weekends, gets dirty towards the end of the day!
text:
We had great 2 days in Marriott Waligama Bay. Even though the check-in proces was a bit tedious and after a long tiring drive from Kandy, they forgot to offer us a welcome drink. 
However we finally got the right rooms and it was amazing to see the beautiful view, large clean rooms. There were not towels in one of the rooms and our luggage got mixed up. But all these mistakes were quickly rectified. 
They offered some fresh fruits and a high tea the next day. Which was really nice. 
Ms Monisha was great and took good care of us. She made our stay truly pleasurable. 
We enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was great.  
If you do buy any food/drink within the hotel add 30% to the price written on the menu (taxes!!!). 
The pool area is nice an safe. You can leave your stuff before you step on the public beach outside the hotel.  
On the weekend the pool and the area was super crowded with lots of children. And people dropping behind their used towel anywhere and everywhere. 
Towards the evening when the pool got a bit less crowded, it was too dirty to swim.  
The beach access is amazing though and we had wonderful early mornings and late evening walks which was wonderful. Kids enjoyed surfing!
title: Great location, large clean rooms, crowded on weekends

text:
The hotel is beautiful.We are staying here for 2 nights. On the second night the staff at the main restaurant disappointed us. We had a great experience until an hour ago.
We were on a bed and breakfast. On the first day we had buffet dinner at Weligama kitchen and on the 2nd day we went for a boat trip and had dinner outside. We got really tired to stop by for some ice cream. The 2 kids wanted some ice cream. We went to the Weligama kitchen and asked them to give us some basic ice cream from their buffet. They said they would charge us $8 for one portion. Such a shame!! Very disappointed. We stayed at Shangri-la for couple of nights just before heading here as their customer service was top notch.
title: Such a shame! Disappointed

text: An absolute amazing way to finish our 3 week travels around Sri Lanka. We stayed 6 nights and the rooms, grounds, restaurants and service are fantastic. Could not fault the hotel except for one thing, this being that my two teenage sons couldn’t play pool/billiards after 8pm as all equipment was locked away with no compromise from staff. Great way to make them go to their room and jump on screens, which is what we would hope you would hope to avoid on a family holiday and staying at a 5 star resort. May need to rethink your policy Marriott Hotels.
title: Amazing hotel, but one disappointing fact.

roomTip:
Ocean view room is a must if you can afford it.
For surfing lessons, bargain! The boys start by doubling prices!😅
text:
Stayed here 6 days with my daughter.
Take the ocean view rooms, they are worth it!
Room has the required amenities, was spacious and the beds comfy.
Housekeeping could do better.
The breakfast was great, the food in general very good although rather pricey, so I'd suggest opting for half-board at the least.
Service in general was OK. Very good at the restaurant but not that helpful otherwise.
title: Good break from Colombo!

roomTip: Grab a drink outside the hotel.
text: Stayed at the property during low season and it really was a treat. The staff couldn't have done enough for us. The arrival was amazing with a traditional dance and music to welcome us to the hotel. Check in was smooth. The room, well can't say much other than the views were exceptional, lay out was beautiful with a partition door opening into the bathroom allowing for a bath with a view of the sea if that's your thing. Breakfast wasn't overly busy likely being due to low season but the selection was nonetheless fantastic catering for asian, western and continental tastes. A drink by the pool was quite expensive. Would recommend using the facilities but if going for a drink, there are plenty of bars in the area charging half the price of a beer.
title: Exceptional

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
Nestled in Weligama Bay, this Marriott epitomizes style and beachfront luxury in every way The architects of this resort have done a swell job to make the most of its beachfront location to enrich the guest experience. Most of its rooms come with a spacious balcony that offers a treat to the eye: the tranquil turquoise of the ocean, the glorious green of the palms - easily the best views of the bay.

LOCATION: Spectacular location right in the heart of Weligama Bay - less than 3 hour's drive from Colombo

DINE + DRINK: Multiple F & B outlets.Specially thank for Dimuthu.His service is very good. The poolside bar is your best option to enjoy the beach with a drink. The Lobby level bar also comes with great views of the bay. Breakfast served at the WELIGAMA KITCHEN restaurant is an extensive affair covering regional and international cuisine that is absolutely worth waking up for! Hands down,of the best breakfast buffets I have ever had on this island!

ROOM: We stayed in Room 819, which was an ocean-view Corner SUITE, so this review is based on that; The Room was super wired and equipped with all kinds of electronic and electrical gadgets including an excellent ESPRESS machine and easy access to USB charging and direct HDMI connections to the TV. SIZE: Huge Living Room with a massive couch and an equally big bedroom. The Suite also had a massive Balcony running across both rooms with multiple areas to lounge and chill out there; VIEW: Spectacular and sweeping views of the Ocean through huge floor-to-ceiling windows from both the living room and bedroom; AIR-CON: Perfectly functioning cooler that helped in setting the perfect room temperature; BED: Comfortable bed that played the expected part of putting me to sleep; BATHROOM: Stand-in shower; TOILETRIES: Lovely Spa quality Toiletries by O2 brand.

FACILITIES: Very good Fitness center with a good range of machines, weights and cardio equipment perfect for a full on workout. The swimming pool is fantastic too and comes with ocean views. They also have a nice QIAN spa and recreational area with a lot of games like Table tennis, Pool, Foosball, etc

SERVICE: Friendly staff that took care of all our needs with a smile and made us feel pampered and well taken care of.

HOW WIRED YOU WILL BE: Free high-speed Wi-Fi that works well all over the property. Huge Plasma TV screens - one each in each of the rooms - dishing out a wide variety of channels spanning sports, news, music, movies, and entertainment in multiple languages
title: F&B Service, Special thanks Dimuthu

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
roomTip: Recommend Half Board basis.
text: Super resort located in the Weligama Bay, in the southern coast of Sri Lanka. Stayed here for 2 nights, attending a family wedding. The wedding itself was spectacular and this is an ideal resort for a beach wedding in Sri Lanka, with a beautiful garden and a roof top terrace with breathtaking views off the ocean,  ideal for a pre wedding day cocktail reception. The rooms are spacious,  sparklingly clean and well equipped with all important amenities, including a balcony with an ocean view. The breakfast buffet is amazing with an international spread of mouth watering Sri lankan, Indian and Western cuisine. The sprawling white sandy beach was clean and ideal for an early morning stroll / jog to burn off those calories after the sumptuous breakfast. You will also meet the fishermen returning in their boats,  bringing in their overnight catch. The hotel also has a well equipped Gym. The staff are very friendly, helpful and will go out of their way to oblige. I would like to give special accolade to TWO individual staff members who were exceptionally helpful and caring - Amaya Silva and Moneesha Hengadara. I stayed at this resort in 2018 with friends and am happy to say that the resort has maintained their very high standards and I hope they will continue to do so into the future!
title: Beautiful Resort with a fantastic beach

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
I have been to the Weligama Kitchen many times for a meal but this was the first time I spent a long weekend at this beautiful property. Check-in was smooth &  complimented with the smiles of the staff at the front desk & a refreshing welcome drink. We were offered a room at a higher floor overlooking the beautiful Indian ocean, which was clean & equipped with modern tech such as automated blinds. House keeping & the room service staff  responded rapidly to our requests & they were attentive. 
Breakfast at the Weligama Kitchen consisted of a large spread of food ranging from salads, cheeses, & Continental & Asian counters. My favourite was the dessert section which not only housed cakes & fruit dansih but also different flavours of ice cream. But the dosai & the eggs benedict I ordered were not upto the standard. The chef who prepared those lacked finesse & presentation skills. However the staff was friendly & amicable & looked into all our requests. The only negative remark is with regard to the response of the reservations team on my special request for early check-in. In addition, in room welcome amenities would have impressed me a lot. Overall it was a memorable staycation & looking forward to visit again! 🤩
title: Long Weekend Staycation 🤩💦🍃💥

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
We had a nice stay at Weligama Bay Marriott Resort.

From welcome to departure it was a thrilling experience. Once thing to specially highlight is all the staff were really friendly and looked after our requirements very professionally.

Room was spacious and clean. Had a nice view of beach and sea. Lot of kids activities including movies, pizza making, etc. Check out the full program from kids club. Also many indoor activities to spend time. Food was delicious and had a good spread. Overall really satisfied with the stay. 

Special thanks to Nishadi for the superb welcome and introductions experience and Lakeesha from Weligama Kitchen for looking after us very well 

Highly recommended to anyone looking to have a good stay around Weligama area.
title: A nice stay at Weligama Bay Marriott Resort

text: Overall it was an impeccable hotel experience. Starting with reservations, Kalani helped so sincerely to proceed with an upgrade that we really obliged for. It was an unforgettable hotel experience and thanks a bunch for the amazing experience Marriott Weligam.

text:
All rooms face the pool/beach.  Room nice size.  Water provided and replaced daily.  Bead and pillows comfortable.  

Buffet breakfast - lots of choices.

Several other properties within walking distance for other food options.  Service was ok.  Staff very friendly and helpful.

Negatives - lots of kids at pool.  Music at pool starts in afternoon and continues until around 11:00/ and or music from hotel next door.

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text: Not recommended for people who want tranquility or value for money. Place is full of screaming children and the pool was small and shallow and filled with children in diapers. The property is not as large as made out to be and quite shoddy. The hotel is in fact an eye sore on the otherwise lovely landscape as a rectangle concrete mass that can be seen for miles. The food was over priced and service extremely poor. Room was okay but dated and lacked amenities expected of a 5 star hotel. We stayed at the ShangriLa Colombo before and went on to the Anantara Kalutara-- now that's what you call 5 star! Suggest unless you are desperate to learn surfing or have lots of babies with you who you can cram in the same room with you, find somewhere else to go.
title: Not recommended!

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text: The beach is too good. You can surf learn to surf. You can walk into the water for a bit before you lose your footing - that’s amazing. Be careful the waves can be harsh but it’s better than most beaches. Would visit again. The rooms have a really nice view with a balcony. The scene near the pool is very lively. The cocktails are super nice. In room food is quite good.

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
We arrived slightly early to the hotel. We were warmly welcome by the staff. Shashini guided us to a waiting area for our welcome drink and promptly moved us to the reception once someone was available. I must commend her infectious enthusiasm. Check-in process was as smooth as you can imagine. Receptionist was kind enough to upgrade us to a room on the 9th floor.

Then one of the staff took us to the room and showed us around. The hotel is new and the rooms are incredible. they are spacious, modern and clean. Rooms have an amazing view of the bay where you can see the beautiful ocean, traditional fishing boats, surfers and the tourists enjoying the beach.

Staff were friendly, warm and attentive. Throughout our stay we experienced an incredible hospitality. Hotel is convenienetly located next to a couple of pool clubs. However, there's plenty of places and options for you to enjoy within the hotel.

Breakfast buffet was big and staff were once again on top of the game. Food was delicious. However, we rocked up as soon as it opened, i did notice that few of the stations were not ready.

Check-out process was fast and smooth. I would definitely stay in this hotel again and I regret only staying 1 night.
title: True 5 star service

I wanted to take a moment to express my sincere gratitude for the exceptional service you during my recent dining experience at Weligama Kitchen located Marriott Hotel, Weligama.  Your attention to detail, warm smile, and friendly disposition truly made the evening unforgettable.

From the moment we sat down, you made us feel welcome and attended to our every need with utmost professionalism and efficiency. Your recommendations for dishes  were spot on, and we truly appreciated your knowledge of the menu.

Your courteous demeanor and kind hospitality were truly above and beyond, making our dining experience one we will cherish for years to come. It's people like you who make all the difference in the world of hospitality, and we are grateful for the care and attention you provided during our visit.

Thank you, Dimuthu, for a wonderful evening and for being the epitome of excellent service. We look forward to our next visit to Weligama Kitchen.

Warm regards,

Michelle Weerasuriya , Marie Koelmeyer and Dyan Koelmeyer .

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text: Good first: location, views, etc are stunning! Room and bed also very comfortable. Now the bad: check in was an absolute mess, we were asked to wait without even so much as the offer of a glass of water, as our rooms were not ready even though we arrived well after check in time. Confusion seemed to be the order of the day on the front desk. When I enquired about a drink for my eighty year old mother, I was pointed to the bar, where I duly ordered water and a mock tail for mum, and beers for my husband and I, only to discover that we would be charged for these…. Even though we were waiting for the hotel to get its act together- our experience was poor, and management needs to get its act together.
title: Very poor checkin service!

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text: This is my second visit to Weligama Bay Marriott. The hotel rooms are impeccably clean and offer stunning views. The entire staff is exceptionally friendly, and we are especially grateful to Mr. Ashane Fernando, the Bar Manager. His outstanding customer service and attentiveness stood out, and he even organized a delightful cocktail lesson for us, which was a wonderful experience. The food at Weligama Bay Kitchen is fantastic, and we extend our gratitude to Chef Navin, Chef Raghu, Chathurang, Ivantha, and the entire restaurant staff for their exemplary service and attention to customers. placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
roomTip: The bar at the pool is exactly twice as expensive as the bar inside the hotel.
text: An excellent hotel for relaxation in the heart of Weligama! Despite the fact that the hotel has been standing for a very long time, the interior is incredibly sacred, clean, and modern! Beautiful rooms, all with ocean views; and of course, it's necessary to choose the higher floors, we were on the 9th out of 10 and the sunsets, sunrises, and just the view of the bay are magnificent. Very friendly, polite, and responsive staff, always ready to help with anything. Very tasty breakfasts, and any request is fulfilled willingly! The only downside is that coffee is served from an automatic coffee machine, and it's very not tasty. In any other decent cafe in Weligama and the surroundings, coffee is brewed, and we had to go to other places just for the sake of coffee. Also, it's a bit strange that the bar near the pool is exactly twice as expensive as the bar inside the hotel or the restaurant there, somehow this is not nice. And it would be great if surfboards were available for rent at the hotel, and it wasn't necessary to rent them from locals on the beach, who see that you come out of an expensive hotel and jack up the price indecently! The pool area is very clean and beautiful, but the sun loungers on the shore look very shabby, it would be great if you could fix this. But overall, we really liked everything, we will definitely return!!!
title: One of the most beautiful hotels in Srilanka

text:
Poor hygiene policy. We stayed there for three nights and payed almost 1K USD. The hotel doesn’t meet Marriott standards in Europe or USA. We found cockroaches both in the restaurant whilst eating and in our room. We raised this with the management. However they were extremely unprofessional and rude, stating that “this is out of their hands“. It ruined our holiday mood. 

Location and view from the high floors is good. However you can get this in nearby places as well. Also, the staff in general are very kind and attentive.
title: overpriced with cockroaches issues

roomTip: Overpriced, hyped ‘5 star’ hotel.
text:
Absolute disgrace to the name of Marriot! Overpriced, and the management is extremely rude and unprofessional! Cockroach infested ‘5 star’ hotel in Weligama. The managements mentioned ‘IF THE CUSTOMER IS UNHAPPY IT IS OK’ (shows the attitude of the way the hotel is run by the management). The word HYGINE does not exist in their world.

After paying almost $1K for three nights, we had to encounter cockroaches in the hotels restaurant. Run away and do not book this hotel unless things change drastically! I personally encountered a racist experience as the management expected me be used to cockroaches due to my skin colour!!

Lastly, bed linen was dirty.

On a positive note, location is great but you can find similar/better/cleaner hotels near it. Furthermore, the staff in general are extremely nice and helpful and even them agreed there’s an issue with cockroaches in the hotel.
title: Overpriced cockroach infested hotel

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text: The hotel is in a wonderful location with great facilities. Our room was lovely with fantastic views. The pool area was also perfect with great beach access. Breakfasts were excellent with a wide range of options. We ate in the hotel once at Big Fish and the food and service were excellent. All the staff were lovely: friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our personal assistant Nishadi was welcoming and particularly helpful. She told us about events and responded effectively to any questions we had or requests we made. placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
We stayed at this property for 2 nights. 
Beautiful property by the beach, however the check in was not good. The host who seated us completely forgot we were waiting to be checked in. People who came after us were offered the welcome drink and chcked in whereas we were still waiting in the lobby without a welcome drink for nearly 15 to 20 minutes. Upon approaching the reception they apologised for their mistake and gave us a free upgrade to a higher level room on 10th floor. We appreciate it.
Host needs lots of training. The day before we checked out at 5.30pm the host sent us a message offering a complementary afternoon tea asking us which day we would like to take the afternoon tea offer. We believe she mistook us for another guest. Clearly the host assigned to us was unaware how long we were staying at the hotel and when we were checking out. Surely one would expect the host designated to a guest to have complete knowledge of the guests duration of the stay and date they check out so they could enjoy the complementary offers provided by the hotel. Upon advising that we wont be able to have the complementary afternoon tea the Asst. Front office Manager Randula apologised and kindly offered us take away sandwiches for lunch when we checked out.
Sou Chef Ragu was outstanding and went out of his way to provide us an authentic crab curry for dinner which was delicious. 
Restaurant staff in particular Fayaz and Dimuthu were very attentive and friendly and made us feel home each time we dine in the restaurant. However some breakfast staff were not friendly and no smile. They were talking loud in the restaurant in their native language. Some restaurant staff were in La-La Land not paying attention to the guests. Certainly restaurant staff need training. As an ex hotelier I was surprised to see this kind of behaviour in the restaurant. 
House keeping staff did an excellent job.
title: Beautiful hotel by the beach

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
Beautiful resort and amazing staff.  Randula the assistant front office manager really made our checkin process smooth and provided us with 1 room out of two early so we could start to enjoy the resort prior to checkin time.

The rooms are lovely and the shower is really good.
The pool is not freezing but a lovely temperature and the beach is gorgeous.

Breakfast has so much choice and the fleshing cooked dosa to order was delicious like everything else at breakfast.  The staff were so lovely and service was great.

I just wish I had stayed more than 2 nights as it was the best hotels we stayed in while touring Sri Lanka.
title: Beautiful resort I would highly recommend

placeInfo: {'id': '12553294', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Marriott Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2023, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973011, 'longitude': 80.43952, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12553294-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Marriott_Resort_Spa-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.marriott.com/en-us/hotels/cmbmc-weligama-bay-marriott-resort-and-spa/overview/', 'address': '700 Matara Road Pelana, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '700 Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelana', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 52, 'count2': 36, 'count3': 70, 'count4': 212, 'count5': 1653}}
text:
Our first experience of the hotel walking in was very pleasant with good views out to the sea and helpful staff however that quickly changed as the check in experience took far too long. We were then shown to our room which also had great views and was a lovely size. The interior design of the hotel was sleek and clean with great views of the tree line in the distance through windows along the hallway.

However, the exterior design really left us with a sour taste in our mouth, the size of the hotel blocked views from the sea (lots of whale watching trips and water sports to enjoy in the area) of that natural landscape and it was grossly out of proportion to the surrounding area. There were also a number of power cuts throughout our stay which were backed up immediately although on one occasion we were in an elevator which  come to an abrupt stop and we were stuck for a minute or so, which was momentarily very scary for all in the lift. The scale of the hotel probably results in a significant amount of required energy but with this and the hideous exterior design, we left regretting our choice of hotel. 

We booked this hotel without looking into it after another hotel in the area was not up to standard and we saw this was available and more similar to our life in Dubai so knew what to expect. We did get that experience so job done from that perspective but this is no way represents value for money and is not sympathetic to the surrounding culture or beauty of Sri Lanka.
title: Provides you with luxury but at the cost of the surrounding area.

roomTip: Best come with a group and book the entire venue out. Good value for money in terms of quality accommodation.
text: An outstanding stay over 6 nights/7 days with family. A very clean and family friendly venue. The service is as good as any 5 star hotel, very accomodating staff and management on site. The rooms are spacious and cleaned everyday. Easy access to the beach. The food is as authentic as you can get when it comes to Sri Lankan cuisine. A very homely and friendly atmosphere, thanks to the staff and management. Would recommend this place to anyone who wishes to visit with family or friends. Walking distance to a number of restaurants down the beach and within walking distance to the main town.
title: Clean and spacious venue with friendly and professional staff and great menu

text: We were in Parangi Weligama for a few days with family. Firstly, the place was amazing, with the beach at your door step. Rooms were very comfortable and spacious, including the family rooms. Delicious Sri Lankan and western style food was prepared for us every meal and they looked after us well. I would highly recommend.

text: Sea view accommodations offer breathtaking views, as well as a generous spread and a friendly touch in all aspects of the experience, including ambience, food, and service. It was fascinating staying at Parangi Weligama. Very pleasant staff at all times, especially Mr. Lakmal (the manager), who went above and beyond to make our stay at Parangi an extra memorable experience because it was a much-needed holiday for our family. placeInfo: {'id': '23398937', 'name': 'Parangi Weligama Bay', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 64, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.999715, 'longitude': 80.26739, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d23398937-Reviews-Parangi_Weligama_Bay-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themacollection.com/parangi-weligama/', 'address': '736 Matara Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '736 Matara Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 2, 'count4': 7, 'count5': 53}}
text:
Lovely and comfortable 'garden' room with outdoor seating although the (much needed) fan - and wifi (router outside near fan) - stopped working - eventually repaired by staff. It is in a wonderful setting with views to the sea when seated on the restaurant patio. The food was reasonable but quite a few of our choices were not available. Staff were pleasant but some very young staff serving who didn't seem to be too sure how to lay the table or what menus to offer us and disappeared to get my partner's beer and not waiting for my choice! In fact very few staff were ever visible when we were in the main hotel.

The cafe at the beach end of the complex didn't appear to be manned and there was no-one encouraging passers by to come and eat there despite the menu being displayed, which is a shame.

The enormous Marriot - and other accommodation - is a little way along the beach from the hotel which means that all the surfers were also a little way from the hotel's beach area making it pleasantly quiet.

So, lovely quiet location, comfy accommodation but, for us, the service was definitely lacking for such a pricey hotel.
title: Great location and comfortable accommodation but service is lacking

placeInfo: {'id': '23398937', 'name': 'Parangi Weligama Bay', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 64, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.999715, 'longitude': 80.26739, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d23398937-Reviews-Parangi_Weligama_Bay-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themacollection.com/parangi-weligama/', 'address': '736 Matara Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '736 Matara Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 2, 'count4': 7, 'count5': 53}}
text:
Our stay at Parangi was a lovely experience. It was like home away from home a villa ultra spacious and extremely clean. It had an outdoor sitting and small garden with a gate which made it complete. It is secure with a main gate and beautifully maintained courtyard pool and direct access to the beach. It's a quiet and relaxing place by the beach.
Suresh Palitha and the entire team were always ready to help with a smile. The Continental and Sri Lankan food was freshly prepared and delicious. We mentioned dietary requirements only once they made sure the meals were right during our stay. 

A big thank you to all.

placeInfo: {'id': '23398937', 'name': 'Parangi Weligama Bay', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 64, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.999715, 'longitude': 80.26739, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d23398937-Reviews-Parangi_Weligama_Bay-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themacollection.com/parangi-weligama/', 'address': '736 Matara Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '736 Matara Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 2, 'count4': 7, 'count5': 53}}
text:
This Hotel was absolut amazing! Very clean, top Beach, Big Room, very beautiful Garden far away from the noisy road, top pool !! And finally best food in Weligama !! You feel like you live in your own property with an amazing view to the sea.

The staff and the cooks prepared every meal for us according to our wishes and it was the best food we ate in Sri Lanka. Don't let the small menu put you off; if you want something specific, ask or pre-order a tsg. the service is excellent and they will fulfill your wish.

At least the staff makes the difference. The staff of Parangi Weligama was the best we ever had in 35years of Sri Lanka traveling. Special thanks to Lakmal and Suresh and all the others. ❤️ Now, after our return to Germany our Kids Somea and Ella always asking for you and want to have pancakes 😃.  The staff at Parangi were very lovely, they were very on point, but not intrusive, the took care when a kid was close to the pool. They make you feel best in every situation. It was just an amazing experience at Parangi Weligama! Thank you very much 🙏🏽
title: The best place on the south coast of Sri Lanka 🤙🏽

ownerResponse:
{'id': '937032439', 'text': 'Dear Guest, 

We are sorry to hear about your negative experience during your stay at the Villa about a month prior to your review. However, it is surprising to note that none of these concerns were brought to our notice during your stay at the villa and in fact initially you had communicated to our manager about losing some cash at another restaurant you had visited outside our Villa. Carrying out a turndown service is part of our daily routine and in this instance we had not done so as per your request on the second day and not at our discretion. We however would like to apologize and accept the water stagnation due to the torrential rains we had during your stay in December. However, I believe our staff did their utmost to ensure you were not inconvenienced due to this. We do apologize if there were a noise from the kitchen and we will take extra measures in future to avoid such. Finally Thank you for your positive feedback on the food and our chef. We sincerely hope you do come back and stay with us once again. 

Thank you 
Manager, Parangi Weligama Bay', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-06', 'responder': 'Sheran Fonseka', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
placeInfo: {'id': '23398937', 'name': 'Parangi Weligama Bay', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 64, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.999715, 'longitude': 80.26739, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d23398937-Reviews-Parangi_Weligama_Bay-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.themacollection.com/parangi-weligama/', 'address': '736 Matara Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '736 Matara Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 1, 'count3': 2, 'count4': 7, 'count5': 53}}
text:
We stayed at Parangi Weligama Bay, Sri Lanka for 4 nights in Dec 2023. 

A family of 4 (2 younger children)

Bad Points:

We had money stolen - twice!! From an open handbag, small amount ($20) taken on day 2, larger amount ($35) following day, staff pretty unhelpful in dealing with this (felt uncomfortable for rest of stay). Hotel seemed pretty secure with staff and security so can only assume it was taken by someone that had access to a key to our room

Room not cleaned daily - would expect this (without getting robbed!) for the cost of the room 

When it rained, water flooded the main entrance to the hotel making it impossible to use this entrance (had to use beach exit and walk longer way round)

Unsafe bunkbed - squeaks so much unusable, too high for younger children, big gap at wall side, broken parts 

No mosquito nets despite 4 poster bed which would accommodate them 

Painting resort in peak season 

Massage oil used by in-house masseuse not nice - bad smell, old 

Garden room had no view 

We were in the Avacado room which joined on to the kitchen with a window so was noisy with staff voices and activity, felt a little unprivate 

road outside dangerous to walk along 

Good points: 

Staff friendly (except one that robbed us twice!) especially Muthumal, great with kids 

Food tasty and fresh, very accommodating Chef, delicious breakfasts 

Generally resort is clean 

In house massage good and reasonably priced (except oil used was awful)

sun beds located at pool and cordoned off to create a private beach area which was nice 

Nice yoga and food places nearby
title: Shame our money was stolen from room as otherwise good

text:
The first place that comes to my mind when I think of a holiday in Sri Lanka is Cape Weligama.
Everything about this place is phenomenal, the location, the villas, hospitality and the food.

Will I ever go back to Cape Weligama ? 100% YES
It was one of our best holidays.

roomTip: The person assigned to us for the stay Nuwan Sajith who was absolutely lovely - amazing person and so helpful
text:
Our stay was absolutely phenomenal. The stay far exceeded our expectations. We had an upgraded room. Since it was our anniversary which I hadn’t mentioned before up until our arrival just as a casual chat to the staff, they had set up a cake in the evening and made us feel even more welcome! The room was absolutely beautiful and luxurious. 

The food was all ala carte i think due to season but either way it was basically world class. 
The stay was relaxing, in the midst of greenery, wonderful bird life, with a view of the ocean. 
Only downside was we stayed one night! 

Lovely place. I am aware renovations will go on so It will become even bettr so!
title: Sublime stay

text: Stunning hotel with an old school charm in a great location. The rooms are huge our terrace overlooking the pool was a great feature and our bathroom was great with many thoughtful features. Staff at the hotel go above and beyond, Gee did a great job at showing us around and checking in to make sure we had everything we need. Breakfast is delicious and has loads of options on offer. We had  2 massages whilst at the hotel which were lovely and the restaurant is worth a visit. Areas which can be improved - our driver had issues with the road coming into the hotel which had been damaged by the rain, the televisions in the room are slightly outdated and don't have netflix.
title: Stunning hotel with an old school charm in a great location

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
text:
For a relaxing holiday, it's best to head south to the vicinity of Weligama, a favorite spot for surfers. Here, Cape Weligama (Relais & Chateaux) stands out as the premier destination. This renowned hotel boasts 39 boutique villas and suites spread across 5 hectares of a former coconut grove on the dramatically picturesque Cape Weligama. The primary draw of this location is the stunning views, views, and more views.

The Ocean Terrace Restaurant, where guests gather for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, is perched on a cliff, providing an unparalleled vantage point to take in some of the best scenery imaginable. 

Cape Weligama also offers three secret spots—secluded areas perfect for watching the sunset. Each spot is equipped with a table and chairs, and can be reserved for a romantic lunch or dinner. 

The villas themselves are spacious, each covering at least 130 square meters, and are built in the local architectural style. Each villa features its own private pool (shared between two or three villas) and a spacious terrace furnished with a table, sun loungers, and a sofa. It's an idyllic spot to sip tea while listening to the tunes of Frank Sinatra or Ella Fitzgerald.

The cuisine at Cape Weligama is another highlight. Talented chefs deliver an impressive culinary experience starting with breakfast. However, the evening meals truly showcase their skills. A standout feature is the Chef's Table at the Tableau restaurant, where a seven-course dinner is prepared before your eyes. This culinary journey includes appetizers, soups, sorbets, main courses, and desserts, making for an unforgettable dining experience.

Chef Ishara Wijesinghe has honed his craft in various countries including Dubai over a 20-year career. He returned to his homeland to perfect his skills in Sri Lankan cuisine, infusing it with European gastronomic techniques. The result is exceptional—his cooking method could easily earn a Michelin star. Guests can ask about the secrets of local cuisine, get excellent recipes, and engage in conversations about global culinary traditions and life in general.

For those seeking adventure, Cape Weligama offers a variety of activities, from surfing lessons and whale watching excursions to guided tours of nearby tea plantations and historic sites. In conclusion, Cape Weligama is not just a place to stay; it's a destination that offers a perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and immersive cultural experiences.
title: Wonderful Stay

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
roomTip: Think twice before you go to Cape Weligama.
text: The most arrogant management is at at Cape Weligama, specially the Sales Director (I think his name is Chaminda) and his colleague.  In simple words hospitality was below Zero. I was on a business trip under the invitation of one of my valuable clint to cover an evening hosting. Out of no where this Sales director appears in the middle of the meals and insisted that he wanted some coverage done for his personal usage, which is not part of my briefing form my client. In few mints time again in the middle of me having my dinner, he pulled me out and wanted me to show him the coverage I did so far, and started lecturing me about my duty  by asking me to come to a corner. That director and his colleague didn't know any one who is at his property is guest and to be polite if he wants something done, instead they was so arrogant, annoying had guts to disturbed the gusts dinner in the middle of it too . Hence I decided to check out from Cape Weligama immediately and and which I did at 11/30 PM mid night. Horrible experience, and hence I will not recommend this property to any one or either I will step in to this ever again.
title: Arrogant Management!!

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
roomTip: Stay longer at this place as planned 😉
text:
After having stayed twice both at Ceylon Tea Trails and Wild Coast Tented Lodge I finally wanted to experience the „Sea“-part of the Resplendent Ceylon Hotels. I am always skeptical about Conde Nast Traveller Hot-List Hotels but Cape Weligama really is a true gem! The service was so great and I loved the tranquility and general atmosphere of this place. The Hotel is immersed in its surroundings not separated from it, giving exit to the surrounding beaches. Everything was beautifully maintained and clean. I was upgraded to a villa, which I loved. Sajith showed me the property and did an amazing job. Since I unfortunately only had one night he saved me a lot of time by explaining and showing everything to me directly after arrival. He also made sure that I knew how to contact him, if I had any questions or problems. 
The food was also delicious. I will definitely return and can highly recommend staying here. Thank you very much!
title: Not to be missed

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
text:
Easily the best hotel my husband and I have ever stayed at! Everything was absolutely amazing. The food was so delicious and the views were supreme. The highlight of our stay was your incredible staff! They were genuinely interested in our comfort and always went above and beyond to make our stay the best ever. Lahiru, Mahendra - our curator and Pradeep were so warm and friendly and we truly appreciate their efforts. Manula from F&B was the absolute star during our stay - he honestly went above and beyond and was the most pleasant person to deal with! Manula assisted us both during breakfast and dinner and at the end of our stay we felt like he was part of our family! My husband accidentally cut his toe on a stone and Manula rushed to get ice and a band aid and was so lovely during the situation. 

As a Front Office Manager myself in Melbourne, I truly appreciate and value outstanding service in the hospitality industry and am so proud to call myself Sri Lankan when I experience stays such as these. Your staff truly seemed like they loved their job as it shows by the way they work!

I can easily say that my husband and I will be dreaming of our honeymoon at Cape Weligama for months and years to come. 

Thank you to the wonderful team at CW - we will be back!
title: HONEYMOON HEAVEN

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
text:
This is the most incredible place we’ve ever been! From the incredible hospitality, to the cliffside views looking at the surfers below, to the delicious Sri Lankan and Western breakfasts and dinners, and to the beautiful rooms, this place deserves all of the accolades. This was our last stop of our (a couple) Sri Lanka trip and it was the perfect ending. Shaun was absolutely wonderful, greeted us at check in and hosted us the entire trip, ensuring our stay was top notch! He was a gem. The sincere nature of all of the staff also did not go unnoticed. All of the butlers, to bartenders, to maintenance around the property to the managers, were genuine and sincere to see you. Another highlight was tasting the different fruit or flavor infused arracks at the Surf Bar onsite. The drinks the bartenders made with those arracks were unreal! 

We stayed in the master suite, and the room was huge with a large private deck with seating. The all wood walk in closet was a nice touch to tuck away our suitcases out of the way, and the rainfall shower was the best treat after a swim at the beach nearby. The shower room also turns into a steam room, although we didn’t try it. And the half moon infinity pool! Highly recommend a swim there at dusk, as it’s pretty incredible to watch the sun go down and surfers below. 

All in all, our hands down favorite part of our trip was Cape Weligama! There’s not enough words to say how special this stay was. We will be returning in the future!
title: Seven stars!

text: We didn’t stay at cape weligama but visited one evening to enjoy drinks by the bar and dinner afterwards. The setting and location were beautiful, overlooking the sea from the cliff top, the drinks and food of a high quality (food portions are on the small side for Sri Lanka) but what stood out most was the service which was the best we’ve experienced even in the few hours we were there - genuine, efficient and elegant. Truly world class. Beautiful property and extremely well maintained and well run. Well done team

text: A beautiful hotel in a stunning location but the star feature was the wonderful people working there. They made the stay and I could not fault their warmth friendliness and professionalism they were outstanding. Our first floor villa with huge suspended pool was beautifully appointed though the pool and outside area needs a bit of updating this did not detract from our enjoyment the view from the room was truly stunning. The main pool on a cliff top is one of the best hotel pools and views you will find anywhere.No hesitation in recommending this lovely hotel there is so much to explore and see so have good walk around.
title: Stunning location lovely hotel with the best possible people.

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
text:
This was our 2nd time on the South coast of Sri Lanka, previously there in 2013, and it is just as beautiful as it was but much busier with more tuk tuks, scooters, surfers, everything really!
The Cape Weligama hotel is at the luxury end of the market price wise but mostly lives up to expectations. The villa was beautiful and we shared the private pool with only one other villa (tbh we had it to ourselves most of the time) and housekeeping by Sadasheena and Vimukthi was fantastic. We were there for 13 nights, started on half board for one week then cancelled that for the 2nd to give us a bit more freedom of choice as the evening menu did not appear to change.
We got out and about using a brilliant local tuk tuk driver, Viraj +94 773969530, who was a very safe, honest and reliable driver and I highly recommend using him. He lives with his family a few hundred yards from the hotel and would appreciate the work.
Inoka looked after us on arrival and Madushan was invaluable in making our departure so easy and stress free.
All in all we had a fantastic relaxing holiday with temperatures always around 31/31 degrees so landing back in London at 5 degrees was a shock, remember to take a jumper, we didn’t!
title: Fantastic holiday, thanks to all

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
text: We have visited CW several times and it gets better each time. Everything is done to make your stay as comfortable and happy as possible. The site is stunning and as the gardens mature,  the landscaping ensures privacy even within areas with shared pools. Accomodation is beautiful and cleaning regimes ensure everything is always spotless. The food is outstanding from the breadless bendedict at breakfast to the local crustaceans at dinner. There are several chefs who will come and speak to you and dining at Tableau, a separate chef’s table is a fabulous experience. Bar staff love the challenge of coming up with a cocktail for you and the Arrak lesson should also not be missed. Without spoiling the surprise, it is much more than it sounds.
title: A fabulous holiday

text:
Hilltop property with beautiful views. Mixture of Villas and suites. All accommodations very large like mini apartments with massive bathrooms, walk in wardrobes and large verandas 
Food excellent large choice. A number of items repeatedly not available - would suggest amending the menu. 
Large portions - could be reduced. 
We stayed three nights and felt that it may be better to have a menu which changed as opposed to the same, however there was a wide choice. 
2 swimming pools, the half moon one was beautiful and quiet and no children under 12. 
Staff excellent special mention to waiter ‘Wishwa’ who went above and beyond especially when they had some staff off sick. 
Rina in the Spa - excellent pedicure. 
Negatives
Steam room in our bathroom did not work and could not be fixed
Lighting in wardrobe/ dressing room poor
Steps uneven so better lighting would be helpful. Not suitable for those with mobility issues 
Laundry and drinks very expensive 
We were on full board but for those not menu prices high, service and tax on top of these prices
title: First Class Accommodation

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
roomTip: If budget allows go for the villas near the oceanfront swimming pool as closest to all the facilities.
text:
The food at Cape Weligama was excellent, we particularly loved the spaghetti lobster dish. It was a very generous serve with plenty of lobster and the pasta was cooked to perfection. 

Breakfast was also delicious with plenty of choices and fresh juices. The staff were all incredibly friendly, efficient and knowledgeable.

 The villa rooms are incredibly large and spacious and tastefully furnished, more like the size of an apartment. 

The property is very hilly but good if you like the exercise. There is no beach to swim at as rocky below, although the pool is fabulous. Buggy's are available on call. 

We booked a premier villa but did have to share the pool with others which I was not a fan of. Plus, we had another villa above us which took away our privacy.

Disliked  · The only dislike was there were no fans outside on the verandas which was annoying if just wanting to relax and read, without them it was far too hot. 

Overall - Lovely traditional boutique style hotel nestled on a side of a hill with a beautiful sweeping ocean vista below. The villas are enormous and extremely comfortable.
title: Relaxing stay with delicious food. 💕🥂🌴
