text: We love staying at Cape Weligama. The villas are fantastic, and allow for a lot of privacy. Most villas have a private pool shared between 3 villas each. There are also some lovely bigger pools on the property. The food is absolutely fantastic! The sea here is pretty rough, so it's more ideal for the view, rather than for swimming. Had a relaxing massage at the spa. Excellent service overall. Looking forward to returning!
title: The villas are fantastic and allow for a lot of privacy

placeInfo: {'id': '6765047', 'name': 'Cape Weligama - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 943, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.9598, 'longitude': 80.40988, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6765047-Reviews-Cape_Weligama_Relais_Chateaux-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.resplendentceylon.com/capeweligama/', 'address': 'Abimanagama Rd, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Abimanagama Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 10, 'count3': 19, 'count4': 73, 'count5': 834}}
text:
This hotel is now,  without a doubt, the finest I have ever stayed at. I travel well and enjoy writing well-deserved reviews.
Firstly,  the rooms are outstanding.  We stayed in a junior suite which was so well equipped. Many bottles of water,  replenished daily with a very well stocked mini bar with beautiful little chocolates and biscuits left in the room every night. 
The bathroom was outstanding, again with EVERY detail covered. 
The restaurant and food was of an exceptional standard and the service was superb. My breakfast,  daily,  was a delightful 'Crab chilli scrambled egg on toast with a crab emulsion'. Dinner was equally exciting and delicious and we thoroughly enjoyed the private candlelit dinner over looking the sea,  watching the fisherman coming and going in the dark. 
Service - how or where do I start? Nothing and I mean NOTHING,  was too much trouble for any member of the incredible team that made our stay so exceptional.  Very special thanks have to go to Thorundu and his team, also the delightful restaurant manager,  who constantly pointed out things of interest,  including rare mammals and planets that could be clearly seen at night through his telescope.
I could write for ages as this was an incredible stay and an incredible experience.  I would love to return!!!!
Thankyou Cape Weligama for the most wonderful stay. Highly, highly recommended  👌
title: OUTSTANDING RESORT IN EVERY WAY

text:
The view was splendid from the restaurant. The excursions provided by the hotel were also very exciting. We visited the tea plantations where you could try the most expensive white tea only grown in Sri Lanka. But the best part of our stay, was the experience with the chef Ishara Wijesinghe, with his amazing cooking skills. He even made steamed grouper as a special request from us, and it was absolutely mouth watering. 

Another activity, that was especially good for the whole family and children, was the cooking class where one could experience the cooking of traditional Sri Lankan cuisine.
title: Chef Cooking !!!

placeInfo: {'id': '7655708', 'name': 'W15 Weligama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 706, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973388, 'longitude': 80.4376, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d7655708-Reviews-W15_Weligama-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://weligama.w15.lk/', 'address': '506 New Galle Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '506 New Galle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 43, 'count2': 33, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 115, 'count5': 463}}
text:
It was a terrible experience. When we entered the hotel no one was available to check us in we had to wait till a very junior staff came by after ten minutes and showed us our room. And after 15 minutes sent the welcome drink to our room. Since the service was bad we decided to go out and have dinner and came back around 11.00 pm and went to bed. While we were asleep at 12.00 some one opened our room and walked in to our room. We were so horrified we screamed then that person apologized and ran out. Then we locked the door and went back to sleep. 15 minutes later some was trying to open our door a gain. And this went on every two hours some one was messing with our door. And while all this was happening on one from the hotel came to investigate or bother about us. It was so scary. Even in the morning when we were out of the room they pretended as if nothing had happened. And when I questioned them they tell me that the guest from the next room was drunk and tried to get in to our room. And it seem normal to them. They didn’t have a manager on ground.
Just a few junior staff members were around. When I asked that they plan to do about that happened they said they were sorry about it and give me Rs 5000/= discount which was a insult to and I told them to keep it.and payed them in full and walked out. 
I don’t recommend this hotel it is not safe at all. And also the room was musty.
title: Terrible experience

roomTip: They play basey music until 11pm. In a front room it was loud - a back room is likely quieter if you like to sleep early.
text:
We stayed here for 1 night and enjoyed our stay. The location is perfect in the middle of weligama beach and surf breaks right out in front. 

Great facilities - sun loungers on the beach, large clean pool and restaurant with yummy food. Staff are also extremely friendly. 

Hotel room was spotlessly clean, comfy beds and modern. We booked a standard double room but got given the oceanview suite up on the second floor which was a nice bonus. We were also able to check in early and use the facilities after check out while we waited for our laundry. 

Only downfall for us was the noise from the DJ at night time. The type of music had a loud base which was turned up around 9pm. And as our room was situated at the front this made it difficult to get to sleep even with the use of ear plugs. 

They do give you a heads up as they are a beach club but just something to be aware of when booking. I think if you stayed in a standard room further back in the hotel it would be quieter.
title: Comfy, clean, fab location, friendly staff, high end facilities.

ownerResponse:
{'id': '959598443', 'text': "Dear Valued Guest, 

Thank you for your feedback. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed our prime location and found our restaurant staff friendly and accommodating. placeInfo: {'id': '7655708', 'name': 'W15 Weligama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 706, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973388, 'longitude': 80.4376, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d7655708-Reviews-W15_Weligama-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://weligama.w15.lk/', 'address': '506 New Galle Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '506 New Galle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 43, 'count2': 33, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 115, 'count5': 463}}
text:
This place is overpriced. 

The positive thing about this place was its location, Weligama Bay. As you enter the room, the interior looks cosy but when settling down the impracticality overtakes the interior decor. 

The rooms are noisy with the busy street, exhaust vents and extremely loud music coming from around.

The restaurant has a decent selection of food. Again the loud music overtakes the serenity of the ocean and the waves.

The front office staff is not trained to handle simple inquiries. Stayed in the hotel for a couple of days and was rather disappointed. 

Restaurant staff were friendly and accommodating.
title: Overpriced

placeInfo: {'id': '7655708', 'name': 'W15 Weligama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 706, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973388, 'longitude': 80.4376, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d7655708-Reviews-W15_Weligama-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://weligama.w15.lk/', 'address': '506 New Galle Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '506 New Galle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 43, 'count2': 33, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 115, 'count5': 463}}
text:
I've dined at W15 Weligama numerous times and have always been impressed with their excellent service and delicious food. The staff is attentive and friendly, making every visit a pleasant experience. The ambiance is perfect for a relaxing meal by the beach, and the menu offers a variety of flavorful dishes that never disappoint.

However, during my recent visit, I ordered the chocolate mocha tart and was quite disappointed with the portion size. While the dessert tasted great, it was surprisingly small, especially considering the price. Given the quality of the food and service at W15, I expected a more generous serving.

I hope they reconsider the portion sizes for their desserts to match the value and standards they are known for.
title: Great Service and Delicious Food, but Disappointed with Dessert Portion

text:
Gorgeous hotel for the end of our trip to relax and unwind! The rooms were stunning and the hotel is in a perfect location to walk and to surf. 
All members of staff were so attentive throughout our stay and made sure he felt very special with birthday balloons and a gorgeous chocolate cake! 
Cocktails and food is a must- especially the wood fired pizza they make fresh with the oven beside the bar. 
The breakfast is also a must try with many fresh made options for hotel stayers- we stayed in 4 different hotels throughout our trip and by this was by the best. 
I hope they don’t expand and get larger as the vibe there is perfect just the way it is!
The manager Andrew always had a smile on his face checking on everyone and the DJ was superb always chatting, live singer every night added to the relaxed and chilled out vibe we were looking for.
title: Amazingly relaxed and vibey  hotel.

placeInfo: {'id': '7655708', 'name': 'W15 Weligama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 706, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973388, 'longitude': 80.4376, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d7655708-Reviews-W15_Weligama-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://weligama.w15.lk/', 'address': '506 New Galle Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '506 New Galle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 43, 'count2': 33, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 115, 'count5': 463}}
roomTip: If travelling with kids, get a deluxe room otherwise a standard room is good for couple only.
text:
Stayed for 2 nights on BB basis with my family in a Deluxe room. Room was cosy and was well maintained. Had the required amenities.

Music by DJ is played from late afternoon till 11pm but it didn't really bother us probably because of the location of the room was away. Music was nice and there was an addition of an expert violinist that upped the atmosphere.

Breakfast was just awesome and hats off to Udaya (the person who attended to us) and the Chef for providing splendid meals.

Need to mention Mr. Andrew who was friendly and always checked how we were faring whenever he saw us.

Beach was just excellent and awesome spot for surfers. 

Definitely a place to return to.
title: Lovely!

placeInfo: {'id': '7655708', 'name': 'W15 Weligama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 706, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.973388, 'longitude': 80.4376, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d7655708-Reviews-W15_Weligama-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://weligama.w15.lk/', 'address': '506 New Galle Road, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '506 New Galle Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 43, 'count2': 33, 'count3': 52, 'count4': 115, 'count5': 463}}
text:
Background to the review:
Sri Lanka got its independence more or less same time as Singapore. Since then, nationalists came into power (and went), decided to get rid of the English language in favour of their Singalese language (Singapore embraced English because they knew how important a common business language is), a civil war came and thirty years later went, and well, Sri lanka is what we have today. A beautiful country, amazing people, horrendous diesel pollution but excellent food! 

We decided to stay three days at this hotel and what a surprise it was. This is an excellent hotel, right at the beach (no beach boys here) wth comfort, excellent food and perfect location. 

The rooms are big, A/C included, large double bed, and excellent restaurant at the beach. By the time we get down for breakfast, the sea is full of surfers (most of who were from Russia), and there are surf schools all along the shore. 

Food is excellent, and there are different themes depending on the day. One evening, fresh fish was available (I took tuna steaks) and enjoyed them. The same evening a musician who was perfect in both Sax and violin, entertained us non-stop. A real treat for me who loves jazz.

Patrons are young (which is cool), and although you hear the music in the room, it's not bothering at all.
title: Perfect stay in a perfect place at a perfect beach in a perfect country.

roomTip: Loud music all evenings.
text: Would not recommend anyone staying here. The design of the rooms is okay, however the cleanliness of the room and smell in the bathroom could have been better. The overall maintenance of the facility could have been better. The service is slow in the restaurant and the DJ is playing loud music all evenings until 11 pm (nice if you’re out for great vibe, not if you want to sleep). The pool looks dirty. placeInfo: {'id': '654256', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 543, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.972214, 'longitude': 80.43982, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d654256-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Resort-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.weligamabayresort.com/', 'address': 'Matara Road Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelena', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 25, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 138, 'count5': 304}}
text: Gave a review of Very Good but that was because of the location. At check in our guide spoke to the receptionist as I had asked if our room was a sea view, and told only partial. So asked if we could upgrade but that was a no, and felt that the young lady was a bit unfriendly. Our guide spoke for us and we were offered another room and I could go see both and choose, which I thought was kind but I am sure it was our guide whom the receptionist was trying to please? We chose the second room S04 which had a better sea view than S09? Room was clean enough. The dining room is down at the beach and just loved having breakfast there albeit there was not a lot of choice but they did make my husband porridge oats every morning which he loved. We chose this hotel rather than the Marriot next door as wanted more of a Sri Lankan experience rather than be in a modern sky scraper building. Dining staff very friendly, more friendly than Miss Snotty at reception! I loved the beach area which was very clean and tidy, though walking along the beach to the right and left you found that the beach there was not clean and filled with rubbish, really shocking, and so glad that we were at the most cleanest part of this beautiful surfers paradise. We just loved sitting on the chairs on the raised stoned area looking out to the sea and watching all the new surfers being trained. Our Half Board menu was ok and enjoyed what we had chosen but the coconut ice cream is to die for, absolutely amazing! Our flights back were late at night and asked Miss Snotty if we could have a late check out, but it would  cost us $117 for 5 hours, I asked if they could do better and since we were half board would they give us some kind of meal or snack before leaving. A definite no but brought the price down to $100. So we agreed on the price but asked if fresh towels and bottles of water could be provided and yes to towels but no to water?  I said to them that we felt that was very mean not to give us the water and they relented. We felt that the receptionist was unhelpful (only doing the minimum)  and bit unfriendly when we were asking on tuc tucs to Mirissa and also a driver to take us to Galle. The hotel driver was so very friendly on our trip to Galle which we thoroughly enjoyed as was the tuc tuc driver to Mirissa. Lovely lovely people. The location of the hotel, The clean beach and pool area and attendants,  the friendliness from the dining staff and where the dining room was were for us the best parts of our stay there. The reception staff not as helpful and friendly.
title: Great beach area

placeInfo: {'id': '654256', 'name': 'Weligama Bay Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 543, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.972214, 'longitude': 80.43982, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d654256-Reviews-Weligama_Bay_Resort-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.weligamabayresort.com/', 'address': 'Matara Road Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Matara Road', 'street2': 'Pelena', 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 23, 'count2': 25, 'count3': 53, 'count4': 138, 'count5': 304}}
roomTip: Savi s surf next door for good surf lessons for beginners. Byob as the cocktails aren't great.
text: Loved the garden villas. Such a quiet place next to the busy happening marriot and kurumba. Kids loved the space, the pool and the surf lessons right on the beach. Totally recommend savi's surf lessons right next to this place. Kurumba is a great place to get meals. On BB the hotel itself is quite pricey given its off season but the staff are friendly. No buffet but decent breakfast set menus. We had a great time with the kids and I will definitely come back for my weligama fix soon.
title: Peaceful family beach holiday

text: I spent 8 days at Weligama Bay Resort with my daughter's family. The resort villas, restaurant, and swimming pool are excellent. The beach is large and clean. text: What a wonderful place. We felt extremely well looked after by all the staff. Beautiful spot, overlooking a great beach. Every one of the staff here smiled and was helpful. placeInfo: {'id': '12275851', 'name': 'Twenty Two Weligambay', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 339, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.965866, 'longitude': 80.45222, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12275851-Reviews-Twenty_Two_Weligambay-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.22weligambay.com/', 'address': '22 Modarawatta, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '22 Modarawatta, Pelena', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 6, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 268}}
text:
Twenty Two Weligambay feels like our second home. Whenever we get the chance, we pack up and head to this beautiful, charming place to relax. It's located right on the famous Weligama Bay, a top spot for surfing, with a massive beach stretch. Our kids love jumping from the room to the pool and then to the beautiful beach. Walking along the shallow beach for meters is a fun activity for all of us.

Our last visit was in March 2024 with my family to celebrate my birthday. The property is managed by a good old friend of ours, and the staff is outstanding, offering great hospitality. The food is always amazing. Plus, there are plenty of options just a few meters away to find pubs and restaurants. We love this place and recommend it to anyone who loves the beach and wants to chill in a charming atmosphere.
title: A perfect family getaway at Twenty Two Weligambay!

roomTip: Appreciate the lovely stair case
text:
Beautiful location by the ocean. Our room was kindly upgraded to ocean view and it was the best hotel view I’ve seen for a long time. I believe the windows have been built extra large to let in the view. The room also had a balcony. 

Nice and clean and very convenient. Higiene could be better around the pool area (sunbeds and towels).

The big surprise was dinner, as the order was taken on check-in and it was cooked to order at the preferred time. It was by far the best meal we’ve had in Sri Lanka this week:

Best chef-prepared food 
Best table service 
Best room view 

Nice staff, young people being trained. 

Recommended!
title: Best dinner and service

placeInfo: {'id': '12275851', 'name': 'Twenty Two Weligambay', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 339, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.965866, 'longitude': 80.45222, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d12275851-Reviews-Twenty_Two_Weligambay-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.22weligambay.com/', 'address': '22 Modarawatta, Pelena, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '22 Modarawatta, Pelena', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 6, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 15, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 268}}
text:
Lovely spacious room, I got a side view over neighbouring property but really only noticed the coconut trees.
Staff in restaurant/bar and at front desk were young but super friendly and helpful. They packed me a takeaway breakfast to take whale watching early the next morning.
The beach is great for swimming, I took a long walk all the way in each direction and then swam as the sun set, the water had no chill whatsoever and soo calm… I didn’t use the pool but it looked nice and clean with fresh towels. The set menu for dinner was really good quality; salad, soup, fish and dessert. The waitstaff were super efficient serving a number of tables at various stages of their meal.
I would’ve loved to stay beachside longer and would recommend this hotel for comfort, quality of rooms and restaurant and definitely overall friendly service with a smile 😊
title: Fab location, great rooms and couldn’t fault the staff or service, great stay!!

ownerResponse:
{'id': '946909830', 'text': "Dear Catherine,

Thank you for your detailed feedback regarding your recent stay at Muhudu Bella - the Beach Villa. We sincerely apologize for the aspects of your stay that did not meet your expectations and appreciate your honesty in bringing these issues to our attention.

Regarding the payment process, we collect full payments in advance due to our high demand and the specifics of our cancellation policy, which aims to minimize disruptions from last-minute cancellations. This policy is consistent with our terms, which are publicly displayed and intended to ensure clarity and security for all transactions, facilitated through direct payment links since Booking.com does not handle payments for properties in Sri Lanka.

We also want to inform you that we have scheduled renovations for Muhudu Bella, after which we will update all online photographs to accurately reflect the villa's updated state along with the unavoidable construction going on in the neighbouring property. This is part of our commitment to transparency and ensuring our guest's expectations are fully met.
We hope the refund for two nights, the complimentary BBQ dinner, and the bottle of Prosecco we offered helped to alleviate some of the disappointment. 

We also appreciate your kind words about our staff. We are committed to empowering them more so that they can provide the level of service our guests expect and deserve, and we regret any perception of limited autonomy.

Thank you once again for your feedback. It is crucial for our continuous improvement. We value your patronage and hope to have another opportunity to host you, providing a stay that truly meets your expectations and showcases the best of what Eraeliya Villas & Gardens has to offer.

Warm Regards,
Savindu Wijesiri on behalf of the team.", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-04-16', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
placeInfo: {'id': '6509273', 'name': 'Eraeliya Villas & Gardens', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.957278, 'longitude': 80.41443, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6509273-Reviews-Eraeliya_Villas_Gardens-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://eraeliya.com', 'address': '299 Walliwalla, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '299 Walliwalla', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 8, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 45, 'count5': 217}}
text:
We booked the Muhudu Bella - the Beach Villa. More expensive than most other properties in the area, but we had hoped it was a case of ‘reassuringly so’.

The first thing to note is the unusual payment process. We booked through Bookings.com yet payment was via a link sent directly from the hotel. At a cost of over USD485 per night (total payment of over 6k) we were not comfortable. After a fuss, the hotel allowed us to pay 1k to secure the property. All very odd as was through a reputable site. They also try to get you to make full payment in advance despite having the option to cancel up to 5 days before arrival (bookings.com terms). Do not pay until after your cancellation deadline, as I am confident you would not be refunded. I think you might be able to choose payment by bookings.com rather than at property. If you have this option, choose bookings. 

The room/ villa  is not as per the pictures. The pictures are misleading. There is now a 3 floor apartment built immediately behind the villa. This is not visible in any pictures provided by the hotel or bookings.com. There is black mould that has spread up to just shy of 1 foot in the base of the shower,  electrical fitting loose, the blinds damaged and exterior needs to be re-rendered in places. Probably worth also mentioning that we had squirrels enter the room for 3 nights. It took the hotel this long to have maintenance come to assess and fix the problem.

The hotel is very expensive  for food, drink and trips. If you do stay, would highly suggest eating out and booking trips independently. Examples: 
- 12 USD for a coffee, 6 USD for a coconut. Coconuts cost 1 USD per everywhere else.
- Trips,  quoted 425 USD for a day trip that should cost no more than 175/200 USD.   The staff know it’s wrong but have to stick to the hotels costing. 

I suspect the  property was great 10 years ago, but the owners (who appear to have day to day involvement)  have not invested in the beach villa/ Muhudu. (I cannot speak for the other rooms as have not been in them.) 

The main building, reception, the view down across the infinity pool to the sea cannot be faulted. That’s the sell. 

Worth noting that if  you haven’t booked a room in the main building (downstairs bedrooms)  you are unable to use the tables/ seating around the pool. These areas belong to the downstairs rooms only. Other guests can use the sun beds only or other seating down on the grass. 

The staff are very lovely but seem to have little autonomy which is a shame as we got the feeling they would have provided a better level of customer service if given it.
title: Overpriced, in need of updating, loose electrics, broken fittings, black mould - the Beach Villa ‘Muhudu Bella’.

placeInfo: {'id': '6509273', 'name': 'Eraeliya Villas & Gardens', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.957278, 'longitude': 80.41443, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6509273-Reviews-Eraeliya_Villas_Gardens-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://eraeliya.com', 'address': '299 Walliwalla, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '299 Walliwalla', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 8, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 45, 'count5': 217}}
text:
This is the best place we have ever stayed.   Ever.   We stayed here for 4 days at the beginning of our honeymoon, and then later on were booked at a 5 star hotel (Anantara Peace Haven).   We literally left early from Anantara, despite the fact that it was non-refundable, and booked two additional nights at the Gardens.   

The setting is absolutely beautiful, the dinner area overlooks the ocean, where you can see surfers and sunsets every night as you have curry and wine.   The rooms are completely unique from one another with incredible attention to detail.   And then we move to the service.   The staff is small, and you get to know them by the end.   I will miss them all.   Dulshan the concierge is professional, relaxed, kind.   Sandun, Rex, Dean, and Jayntha of the restaurant staff are always positive, attentive, and work extremely hard.   The kitchen is wonderful with Sri Lankan and western dishes.   

We are from the US, and its a long trip to Sri Lanka.   However, if we come back, we will definitely be staying here again.
title: Best hotel we have ever stayed in.   Literally.

placeInfo: {'id': '6509273', 'name': 'Eraeliya Villas & Gardens', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.957278, 'longitude': 80.41443, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6509273-Reviews-Eraeliya_Villas_Gardens-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://eraeliya.com', 'address': '299 Walliwalla, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '299 Walliwalla', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 8, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 45, 'count5': 217}}
roomTip: The pool is beautiful but the beach in front of the hotel is not great.
text: Stunningly beautiful.  The hotel is located in front of the sea in a colonial style villa with a garden and old world furnishings and beautiful artwork.  Our suite was spacious and had an enormous terrace overlooking the pool and the sea where we had breakfast each morning.   Unfortunately, the level of the service was not at the standard one would expect from such a facility.  There was hardly ever someone at reception. Usually the receptionist could be seen roaming the garden on her cell phone.  One always had to ask for beach towel since the bin labeled “clean beach towels” was always empty.  Surprisingly there was no turndown service in the evening which meant we had to lower 5 or 6 blinds on the doors to the terrace.  This was complicated by the fact that some of  the blinds were in disrepair.  The price for a massage was $50 on the villa website but $63 in the in-room brochure and an espresso cost $12.  We asked if we could keep our room until 1PM instead of 12 noon and were told that the latest was 12:30.  We left the room at 12:30 and sat in the lobby waiting for the receptionist to appear 20 minutes later and send someone to get our bags. Clearly there was no urgency to make up the room.
title: Stunningly beautiful location, lousy service given the high price.

placeInfo: {'id': '6509273', 'name': 'Eraeliya Villas & Gardens', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 296, 'locationString': 'Weligama, Matara, Southern Province', 'latitude': 5.957278, 'longitude': 80.41443, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612380-d6509273-Reviews-Eraeliya_Villas_Gardens-Weligama_Matara_Southern_Province.html', 'website': 'https://eraeliya.com', 'address': '299 Walliwalla, Matara 81700 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '299 Walliwalla', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Weligama', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '81700'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 8, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 45, 'count5': 217}}
text: Eraeliya is fully deserving its 5* rating. The rooms, suites and villas are tastefully and uniquely decorated with much love and attention to detail. The beautiful grounds and gardens are maintained immaculately. The undisturbed oceanfront location affords stunning views over the ocean with unforgettable sunsets. Even though jungle beach is a favourite launching point for surfers, the sandy cove is also one of the few Sri Lanka beaches for safe swimming. The high level of service and quality of food are additional highlights. Breakfast is huge and stunning,  and the catch of the day is the freshest and most tastefully prepared fish you will find anywhere. The owner Njuri, and the entire staff are fully dedicated to pamper their guests,  and ensure their wellbeing. They provide service at its best! The relatively small size of the estate with only 9 rooms and villas affords a much more private and intimate atmosphere.  Once you arrive, you have no desire to go outside again. Truly, a small slice of paradise!
title: A beautiful slice of paradise, wonderful all around, marvellous, and fully deserving serving its 5* rating!

text: My first 3 nights in srilanka was spent in Weligama, a unique experience at Eraeliya hotel. Specifically in Alaya Suite. This suite offered an unparalleled panoramic view of the Indian Ocean, coupled with a private balcony that seemed like an extension of the horizon itself. The room's design was aesthetically pleasing, illustrating a perfect blend of modern comfort and traditional charm. we had the luxury to enjoy our breakfast at our own specified time and location. The freshness of the food and the variety on offer was commendable. And a special mention has to be given to the front desk reception staff - Thareka and Dulshan, their professionalism and attention to detail significantly enhanced our stay. It is safe to say that Eraeliya hotel is not just a place to lodge, but a unique experience that leaves lasting memories.
title: Unique and one of a kind

roomTip: WONDERFUL - just go
text: We spent two wonderful weeks over this 2023 Christmas holidays and the 2024 new year.  Exceptional experience. Gorgeous villas, lovely grounds, great reef break out front for surfing and a fantastic pool.  Can't say enough positive things.  Excellent service. All staff were too notch and Sandun was a standout - very elegant man and extremely gracious. He is very customer-oriented and charismatic - hopefully he will be the manager one day!  The food was also amazing - the chef is a real star too, very talented with Western and local dishes alike.  Highly recommended!
title: FANTASTIC AND SANDUN WAS WONDERFUL

roomTip: Contact directly the hotel for a good price.
text:
The hotel was a dream! The whole area was a wonderful garden with different buildings, very nicely placed. The main building is a beautiful house, the unconventional hotel lobby was very inviting. We were given a large room with a veranda, right next to the pool. We liked it so much that we immediately extended our stay by 2 nights.
The staff were also extremely friendly and helpful, also in organising transport/taxis.
We have already recommended the hotel several times.
title: One of the greatest hotels in the south of Sri Lanka
